I have used it for low light concert footage shooting HD video. This camera is awesome for low light situations in both photography and cinematography. It is also small enough to fit in your pocket. There are not to many cons to this camera in my opinion. This little baby will serve all my photography needs.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This was a gift for my wife. I wanted to teach her about exposure but I was worried that a DSLR would overwhelm her (and get left at home.) It's small enough to carry around everywhere and you can still manipulate depth of field and shutter speed. It takes great pictures in any mode. User friendly menus are easy to navigate. Pricey but worth every penny.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Download the CHDK and unlock the potential hidden in this camera (and other much cheaper canon cameras). Shutter speeds of over 2000 seconds, autofocus and zoom during video...rgb histogram, zebra mode for over and or under exposed areas...etc...even in the stock factory mode, the auto shots are great and the scene modes are wonderful. The HDR mode is great for dynamic lighting...shoot in RAW...what isnt to like? Plus this camera slips into a pocket....yes, SLIPS....doesnt need to be stuffed in a pocket. too much adjustability and I finally have a camera I can grow with. The Panasonic LX% is bigger, has an annoying lens cap, and is stuck with the features offered by the factory, nothing to unlock...the video is mono only and the panasonic menus and usability are difficult to use. Go cannon ... for a quality product that can double its features by downloading some files and moving them to your SD card. The LX5 only has the 24mm lens to beat the S95, and the G12 actually has less features and a worse lens (but can still use CHDK). The only real next step up is the sony-NEX, or some other 4/3 camera, but at that point size is still an issue. SImply the best camera for its size. Yeah, Fujifilm has a beast coming out soon, but it costs a bundle. just do it. do it. do it. DO it. Do it. DO IT. do IT. DO it. and buy a second battery. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought this because I wanted to be able to have controls such as aperture priority, but didn't want to constantly carry around a DSLR. Obviously, this is not a DSLR replacement, but it has got a great feature set. I especially like the ring around the lens that you can set. That, in conjunction with the click wheel on the back, you can easily change your settings in manual or semi-manual mode. The finish is really sharp - matte black and slightly textured. Nice wide, fast lens, although the nice wide aperture starts going down pretty quickly as you zoom in. The button layout on the top is a little funky compared to other Canon P&S's I've owned, and the pop-up flash takes a little getting used to - had to adjust my natural grip a bit. But, those are minor compared to the featur ... e set and picture quality. Shutter lag is certainly not DSLR-like, but is better than other P&S's I've owned. This is definitely several steps above your typical point-and-shoot. Haven't tried the video yet, but I'm a little bummed its 30p only. Would love a little 24p action on that. I don't mind that it's only 720 and not 1080. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought this camera for my wife because its easy to use like the other point and shoot cameras. What sets this camera apart is the ability to shoot raw. It has other manual functions that I like as well. You can limit your max ISO setting in order to limit noise in your images. It is a very fast lens at the wide end. The image quality in low light is very good. The only complaint I have is that it does not shoot 1080p video. Canon has been a pioneer integrating video into still cameras and I would have expected for them to have 1080p capabilities in this camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Quite a camera. Not your average P&S
Item.Review: I've only had this a couple of weeks, but WOW! I'm more of a DSLR guy, but there are so many times I want to have a camera but lugging around the backpack just isn't worth it. I've also found that when I hand someone my Nikon D7000 and ask them to take a picture of me and my lady, it doesn't come out that well. I had a Canon SD800IS and I liked the results, but I didn't have enough control. Enter the S95. I bought this after reading a ton of reviews including David Pogue of the NY Times (who wrote a love letter to this camera). It is everything it is supposed to be. Full control, really solid. Not a toy. Not much compromising. And yes, i can shoot RAW! If you aren't really into photography, ISO, aperture, etc., don't waste your money. But if you want something to use when you ... r DSLR isn't with you, and you still want a lot of control over your settings, this is the camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Picture quality unbeatable in a compact
Item.Review: Pros: Fast/accurate auto-focus, Good Image Quality, Good in Low Light, Large Clear LCD, Small / Compact ... Cons: Poor Flash We have been through several cameras in the last year. We tried a Sony DSLR which had great picture quality and functions but we rarely carried it because it was so big. We tried a Pentax Optio for it's tough, waterproof design. It was great for outdoor and action shots but indoor pictures had poor quality and so much shutter lag that we could not get a decent picture of our kids. I checked out several compact cameras owned by friends but was unimpressed by the picture quality. We finally decided to suck it up and spend the money on a high end compact. We couldn't be happier. Picture quality is near that of a our previous DSLR. Shutter lag is minimal and picture qual ... ity is amazing, especially in low light, many times without flash. The only complaint I have about the camera is the pop-up flash which is right where you would normally put your left index finger. It is a suprise when it pops up and sticks because of your finger. The camera is a little awkward to hold but you get used to it. I am planning on buying an aftermarket grip for it to see if that helps but I'll keep the camera either way. I am a complete novice when it comes to photography mostly taking snapshots. This camera comes at a relatively high price but I have never taken better quality 'snapshots'. You really do get what you pay for expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I am impressed with the quality of the photos, they are extremely vibrant, alive photos. The color and resolution is remarkable. I took mostly indoor photos and compared them with my older PowerShot photos, hands down there is no comparison. The camera is light weight, easy to use, big LCD and has many manual settings. I dropped my old camera and had to buy a new one.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent camera for a serious amateur
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, with many features
Cons: Battery life could be a bit longer, but not that bad
I needed to buy a new camera that was easy enough for my wife to use, but had enough features for me to really explore photography. We didn't want to get a digital SLR and wanted to focus more on a point-and-shoot camera. This was the one we found.
It has everything that we need and is definitely user friendly for my wife. There are many features for a beginner and advanced photographer. The best part are the manual controls for focus, aperture, shutter speed, etc.
This is worth buying if you want everything in a pocket sized camera. Be prepared to drop some money down, but in the end it'll be worth it for a camera that can do most everything.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Pictures
Cons: Pricey
This is a great camera not only for its compact size but also for the DSLR like features. Pictures are so perfectly exposed for skin tone and brightness. The fast lens makes the low light pictures much brighter than from other compact cameras. The photo stitching is a cool feature though it requires using a software provided by canon. The different exposure modes, the ease of setting over or under exposures, face detection, etc. make this an excellent camera for advanced photographers who don't want to lug around a DSLR. HF-DC1 external flash helps to extend the flash range but needs to be used carefully. You won't regret this purchase - can be carried like a smartphone.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great picture; Many button types; Great handling; Full manual; Low Light Photos; Shift tilt; Great Look
Cons: Larger than some
People are calling this the small camera for pros, and they are right. The low light photos are some of the best I've ever seen. There is a feature that takes photos at different exposures and combines them for high contrast areas: this only works with a tripod, but it still amazing. The quality is so impressive as is the usability. There are buttons, wheels, and even control on the lens, like an old manual camera. There are even features for fun like smile detector and fish eye. I can't say enough good about this camera. I take pictures with it everywhere and have loved the results.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Used for taking pictures of the kids/family. We wanted something that had short lag time that was easy to use; kids don't hold poses and a SLR is too bulky and complicated. It takes time to get used to the flash popping out of the camera body. The flash doesn't fire every time - I think this is due to rapid picture shooting at close proximity to the subject as the camera automatically adjusts modes. The manual features are great and allow us to knock the rust off college photography classes. Price was a bit high, but it sees nearly daily use so we've dealt with it. Overall we love it!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Great pics in low light and without flash. Some cool effects modes and nifty movie function that is better than those low end flipy things. 5 Stars if the movie mode was 30fps and could adapt focus point.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Just got this for my wife and haven't had a chance to really use much but so far am impressed with the camera. We were looking for a pocket sized point and shoot that would fill in when we didn't have our DSLR with us and wouldn't disappoint with photo quality. It seems pretty intuative to use, the screen on the back is excellent and I was able to get some nice low light photos without the flash. The flash can be a little awkward if you are used to steadying the camera holding it with your finger on the top side opposite the shutter button but we haven't had any issues so far.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I am not a camera expert, but before I made this purchase I spoke to a few friends who do know a lot about cameras, one of whom is a professional photographer. I told them I needed something small, easy, robust and portable that takes great pictures. Independently, all three of them recommended the PowerShot S95.I love my new camera. It's small enough to fit in a pocket and I can take it anywhere. It's easy to use and has many options for other settings if one would want to take more advanced photographs. The screen is clear and the case pleasing to hold. I don't think I could have done better.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I purchased this camera mostly out of a need for convenience. Having lugged heavy photo gear for nearly 30 years now, I finally convinced myself to buy something that would be with me at all times with a minimum of effort. I can already say that I have gotten photos that I would not have due to this, but it's no SLR, even with its advanced controls. Actually, I'm having the most fun using the cameras video feature, and it's quite good. However, I can assure you that Canon will design its replacement with focus and zoom functions that operate during filming since unit cannot. Despite that it's a competent product that's well made and very handy!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Great pictures, almost DSLr quality. HD Video is also good, the zoom when using the video is ok, but seems to get blurry if you zoom really far. So only good if you dont plan on zooming much, easy to use and setup. Make sure you buy a SDHC Class 10 Card. Also great low light setting for pictures with low light just switch the mode. Only con is the flash is motorized so if you have large hands you might have a hard time holding this with 2 hands.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Good point and shoot with a lot of control.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great pictures.
Cons: Short battery life (200 shots).
I love this camera! It does have some flaws and no camera is prefect but here are my pros and cons.
Pros -Full manual controls plus raw shooting. -Multitude of shooting modes including an excellent low light mode. -Multifunction ring for flexibility.
Cons -Flash is a little underpowered. -No full 1080p video (it is 720p however). -Battery life could be longer.
Overall this is a camera I highly recommend to pros or semi pros who want a good point and shoot camera for when they don't want to carry their Digital SLR.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: No Jive with a PowerShot S95
Item.Review: The PowerShot S95 takes some absolutely stunning images. It is point-and-shoot very user friendliness. I mean the image quality is amazing. Seeing is believing! I have a Canon EOS 7D and carry the Powershot S95 with me when my Canon 7D is not really practical. I shoot alot, so I am now never with out a camera. The High Dynamic Range shooting is awesome. Another cool Canon feature that the PowerShot S95 has is the Optical Image Stabilizer (IS) counteracts camera shake. For a camera of this size to offer RAW and JPEG file formats and a smart high dynamic range function is very cool. If you post edit your pics shot RAW. The battery life isn't particular generous, but that is what I expected from such a small camera. But don't let size full you, baby this camera can perform...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot S95 10 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I find this to be a great little pocket camera. Good to take out when just going for a walk or short trip instead of my SLR. I have taken a variety of pictures and I am very pleased with the results. Pictures include kids, outdoor foliage, lake and water views, day, night and inbetween. All of them have turned out very good. I have played with the settings features and find they give you whatever control you need to get the result you want. I will say I am not into video and have not used that feature, but will give it a try in the future. The only negative, and one I was aware of before my purchase is the pop up flash. Come on Canon...did anyone in the office try this thing out before putting it on the market. Sure, you can get used to it and avoid the annoyance, but why should we...you h ... ave plenty of other options. Having said that, the flash does work well and produces good results. expand » « collapse
